[Unfortuntely not](https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/14116/mercurial-cross-fork-pullrequests-dont).

'Close branch' closes it on the source fork before merging, it does not close it on the destination fork. You would think it could do either, but it does not. If the merger doesn’t have permissions to the source fork, they don’t see the checkbox and the branch doesn’t get closed.  
  
As far as I can tell, me checking the box just sets what the default value of the checkbox you will see is when you merge it, if you have permissions, otherwise you see no such checkbox when you merge.

Unfortuntely not.

'Close branch' closes it on the source fork before merging, it does not close it on the destination fork. You would think it could do either, but it does not. If the merger doesn’t have permissions to the source fork, they don’t see the checkbox and the branch doesn’t get closed.

As far as I can tell, me checking the box just sets what the default value of the checkbox you will see is when you merge it, if you have permissions, otherwise you see no such checkbox when you merge.
